titleInfo.title: Nashville’s Schools teach democratic principles and prepare to defend them, 1941 April 18

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: “Nashville’s public school officials have planned a program based on democracy and defense. Not only are young people taught the fundamentals of their form of government, but they are taught the necessary principles of preserving it … with airplane motors as his eventual problem, Jack Hurst, 19, is working at present on automobile motors in his eleventh grade studies at Hume-Fogg, but hopes to become an airplane mechanic some day. He is typical of the many young men over the city who are learning their trades through the public schools.” Source: Nashville Banner, April 18th, 1941. Forms part of Record Group 412, Photographs Collection. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
